channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Doctor with "lust for murder" suspected of 10 patients' killings

item.title: U.S. military planes might be spying on cartels, Mexico says
item.description: Any intelligence gathered from Mexican territory would have to be shared under agreements between the two countries, Defense Minister Ricardo Trevilla...

item.title: GSA staff faces massive cuts. And, could NASA launch a Mars mission?
item.description: The General Services Administration plans to cut its budget in half and ramp up monitoring of staff. And, Elon Musk could help propel a NASA Mars prog...

item.title: Trump welcomes back teacher released by Russia
item.description: The US president says the "show of good faith" could play a part in ending Russia's war in Ukraine.

item.title: DOGE cuts $900 million from agency that tracks American students’ academic progress
One killed in ballistic missile attack on Kyiv, Ukraine says
item.description: The attack comes after president Zelensky suggested peace negotiations with Russia could include a territory swap.

item.title: Climate change is threatening cacao crops, researchers say

item.title: Russia releases imprisoned American Marc Fogel in what US calls a step toward the end of Ukraine war

item.title: Goldman axes diversity rule that has 'served purpose'
item.description: The bank ditches a policy that stopped it acting on flotations for firms with an all male, all white board.

item.title: Salman Rushdie testifies about his shock and pain as an attacker repeatedly stabbed him on stage
Pain clinics made millions from "unnecessary" injections

item.title: Republicans split on best path to advance Trump's agenda in Congress

item.title: Russia attacks Ukraine's capital, rules out returning any occupied land

item.title: Three American goods that could rise in price due to metal tariffs
item.description: Donald Trump's plans for tariffs risk raising prices for items from cars to canned food.

item.title: She wanted to be a mom. So she chose a cancer treatment that gave her a chance
item.description: New, less damaging treatments are giving some patients the choice to try to preserve their ability to have children after cancer.

item.title: Crackdown on Bangladesh protesters may be crime against humanity, UN says
item.description: Sheikh Hasina, deposed last year, is accused of putting down protests that left up to 1,400 people dead.
